body: Thanks @nurupo for the report From IRC: > \ Diadlo: are you here? there is an issue with the networking code > \ Diadlo: the "Unix API" one on this page. click on Details https://build.tox.chat/job/libtoxcore-toktok_analyze_scan-build/115/clangScanBuildBugs/ > \ Diadlo: malloc(0) is undefined behaviour, so you should guard the malloc call with an if-statement checking for 0 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)

comment_regular_data.body: --- Reviewed 2 of 2 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-:-Kf24qELrSdRCqDwsoH3:b-jbsf8z)*

Reviewed 2 of 2 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed.

---

*[toxcore/network.c, line 1226 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf2BokSd9z15lu5Zxtr:-Kf2BokTUV4kechf7Y5l:b-kmwybc) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cc407ecc419eda4b2b44f108202886174d24e8f2/toxcore/network.c#L1226)):*
> INT32_MAX

Btw, why do you assume that `int` is at least 32-bit? It might be 16-bit, then your `INT32_MAX` is invalid.

You want to use `INT_MAX` from `limits.h`, which is the maximum number represented by `int`.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1226 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf2BokSd9z15lu5Zxtr:-Kf2oSet_-rr9GOTRN8P:b-1alm47) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cc407ecc419eda4b2b44f108202886174d24e8f2/toxcore/network.c#L1226)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
> INT32_MAX Btw, why do you assume that `int` is at least 32-bit? It might be 16-bit, then your `INT32_MAX` is invalid. You want to use `INT_MAX` from `limits.h`, which is the maximum number represented by `int`.
Sorry. Wrong `count` type. Fixed. What do you think, is it really possible to have `count >= INT32_MAX`? Maybe remove this check + check after loop --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1226 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf2BokSd9z15lu5Zxtr:-Kf2rV1gau-RkKIR0kpP:b-9r3z2n) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cc407ecc419eda4b2b44f108202886174d24e8f2/toxcore/network.c#L1226)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
Sorry. Wrong `count` type. Fixed. What do you think, is it really possible to have `count >= INT32_MAX`? Maybe remove this check + check after loop
I would keep the check. What I'm @iphydf about is what would happen when you do `malloc(sizeof(IP_Port) * INT32_MAX)`, whether the argument to the function can overflow and result in `malloc()` call with a very low argument value, e.g. you do `malloc(2)` when you meant to `malloc(INT32_MAX+2)`, and then try to fit INT32_MAX+2 things into those 2 slots, which results in heap buffer overflow. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1226 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf2BokSd9z15lu5Zxtr:-Kf2zYyvitWB_1rRboqm:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cc407ecc419eda4b2b44f108202886174d24e8f2/toxcore/network.c#L1226)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
I would keep the check. What I'm @iphydf about is what would happen when you do `malloc(sizeof(IP_Port) * INT32_MAX)`, whether the argument to the function can overflow and result in `malloc()` call with a very low argument value, e.g. you do `malloc(2)` when you meant to `malloc(INT32_MAX+2)`, and then try to fit INT32_MAX+2 things into those 2 slots, which results in heap buffer overflow.
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1226 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf2BokSd9z15lu5Zxtr:-Kf3-awuSaftK3XgWMZN:b-zi6bb4) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cc407ecc419eda4b2b44f108202886174d24e8f2/toxcore/network.c#L1226)):*
Previously, Diadlo (Polshakov Dmitry) wrote…
Done.
That works. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1239 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf3-doSagJfmdUF5X24:-Kf3-doSagJfmdUF5X25:b-jvi80i) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c31035628915002050c9e3b830cbd11866a455aa/toxcore/network.c#L1239)):* > ```C > } > > if (count == MAX_COUNT) { > ``` Should be `count > MAX_COUNT` instead, because if `count == MAX_COUNT`, then `count * sizeof(IP_Port) <= SIZE_MAX` holds (it's <= instead of == due to integer division in C which drops the fraction part, e.g. 9/5 is 1 in C), which is still valid to pass into `malloc()`. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*

Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1239 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf3-doSagJfmdUF5X24:-Kf361xHKe2wCV_k9Ff_:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/c31035628915002050c9e3b830cbd11866a455aa/toxcore/network.c#L1239)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
Should be `count > MAX_COUNT` instead, because if `count == MAX_COUNT`, then `count * sizeof(IP_Port) <= SIZE_MAX` holds (it's <= instead of == due to integer division in C which drops the fraction part, e.g. 9/5 is 1 in C), which is still valid to pass into `malloc()`.
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*
@Diadlo Did you forget to push the commit?

Yes. Pushed

---

*[toxcore/network.c, line 1239 at r3](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf3HfvZeH7AylLAVsg1:-Kf3HfvZeH7AylLAVsg2:bystxez) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/cd288321cd6ccf246e2029fb6d8aa0a79229f7e3/toxcore/network.c#L1239)):*
> ```C
>     }
> 
>     if (count > MAX_COUNT) {
> ```

I just noticed that the loop above makes sure that `count <= MAX_COUNT`, so this check is not really necessary. Sorry for not noticing this from the start. You could replace it with assert `assert(count <= MAX_COUNT)` for clarity. 

---

I just noticed that the loop above makes sure that `count <= MAX_COUNT`, so this check is not really necessary. Sorry for not noticing this from the start. You could replace it with assert `assert(count <= MAX_COUNT)` for clarity.
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*

Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r4.
Review status: 1 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed.

---

*[toxcore/network.c, line 1227 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf3Qgq8oUN8ORFvKJ1j:-Kf3Qgq8oUN8ORFvKJ1k:b-cllii) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/5654606a5d9300ee6b2a16e4026cb692df76ad3b/toxcore/network.c#L1227)):*
> ```C
>     int32_t count = 0;
> 
>     for (cur = infos; count <= MAX_COUNT && cur != NULL; cur = cur->ai_next) {
> ```

Either this condition should be changed back to `count < MAX_COUNT` or the assert below should say `assert(count <= MAX_COUNT+1)`, since after this loop ends, `count` can equal to `MAX_COUNT+1` now.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

--- Reviewed 1 of 1 files at r5. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed. --- *[toxcore/network.c, line 1227 at r4](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-Kf3Qgq8oUN8ORFvKJ1j:-Kf3RW9O4lutwjlxvCi6:bxtjnbs) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/5654606a5d9300ee6b2a16e4026cb692df76ad3b/toxcore/network.c#L1227)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
Either this condition should be changed back to `count < MAX_COUNT` or the assert below should say `assert(count <= MAX_COUNT+1)`, since after this loop ends, `count` can equal to `MAX_COUNT+1` now.
Ok, it's fixed now. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-:-Kf3Ra5ifgI1PmxM3N03:b-jbsf8z)*

Hm, actually, now that I think about it, `count` should be `size_t` instead of `int32_t`. It's possible for `size_t` to be 64-bit, and `size_t MAX_COUNT = UINT64_MAX/sizeof(IP_Port)` might still end up above `int32_t`'s max range.

---

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 1 unresolved discussion, some commit checks failed.

---



*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-:-Kf3SAAls7PyHFLub3DR:b-ba78cr)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Yeah, it is, in fact, the case. If `size_t` is 64-bit unsigned integer, then `SIZE_MAX` is `(2^64)-1`.  `INT32_MAX` is just `2^(32-1) -1`. `sizeof(IP_Port)` is at most `19` right now (it could change in the future, so we should assume it to be variable), and [`SIZE_MAX/19 > INT32_MAX`](https://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=(+(2%5E64)-1+)+%2F+19+%3E+(2%5E(32-1)+-1)), so we could overflow `count` on platforms which have have `size_t` as 64-bit unsigned integer.

---







*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/509#-:-Kf3TAbWtg0iftolz97T:b9afwy3)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Done.
